result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Edward Eith

defendant.name: Eith, Benjamin Edward
defendant.address: N4680 Tall Timber Circle, Montello, WI 53949

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Defendant Benjamin Edward Eith appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack appeared by video for Benjamin Edward Eith.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dorlack received an offer this morning but has not had time to speak to the defendant on it yet.  Atty Dorlack asks for another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Atty Dorlack received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court questions the defendant.  Defendant is prepared to proceed without having the information in his hands since his Attorney has it.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in the information.  Defendant understands.

Atty Dorlack enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.   
Set status
bond continued

1:19 PM Defendant Benjamin Edward Eith appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack appeared by video for Benjamin Edward Eith.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dorlack states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech filed the information electronically with the Court.
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and Motion to Amend Cash Bond to Signature Bond

**Amended from cash bond to Signature Bond with same conditions of:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No contact with Victim 1  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Edward Eith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph James Dorlack appeared by video for Benjamin Edward Eith. 
Atty Dorlack states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Dorlack waives time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Set Prelim
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol   *No contact with Victim 1  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

3:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Edward Eith appeared by video, in custody. 
Attorney Kelly Thompson appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Thompson states that the defendant does qualify for PD appointment.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Thompson requests a signature bond or a low cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol 
*No contact with Victim 1 or her residence
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
